body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxcore/23)

comment_regular_data.body: Reviewing so many PRs that have the same or very similar changes (the Travis script files) is getting quite annoying, hope at least one of them gets merged soon :/
As soon as one of them gets LGTM, it'll be merged.
I'll keep #20 open, so it can be independently merged.

Review status: 0 of 18 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion.

---

>                        int *enable_ipv6,
>                        int *enable_ipv4_fallback, int *enable_lan_discovery, int *enable_tcp_relay, uint16_t **tcp_relay_ports,

Review status: 17 of 18 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- _[other/bootstrap_daemon/src/config.h, line 42 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/23#-KOpLQLQZcCVoLu6xCJt:-KOpRPEwapAx-3rFRhUB:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/fa6eeb460ecf0ee065e742ce6048e20952ebd071/other/bootstrap_daemon/src/config.h#L42)):_
Previously, nurupo wroteâ€¦ > Looks like astyle kept the new line where it shouldn't really be kept >
> Done. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/23)_

Now that I have reached the meat of the PR, the CmakeLists.txt, I wonder
1. why do we change the build system
2. and even if there is some very good reason for changing it -- why it's not on the same feature parity than the old one
   - can't disable building toxav, toxdns
   - no option to enable building tox-bootstrapd
   - no option to do static build of the library
   - etc
Hm, you also kept the "die autotools", but you test that toxcore builds only with cake in Travis... I'm confused. If you want to have both, doesn't it make sense to test both of them?

We don't really change it for now, we just add a new one and we'll develop it for a while until it does have feature parity. Reasons for changing it are:
- Maintaining the autotools build is going to cost more time than getting a new one.
- The autotools build is a little broken in that it doesn't use libsodium's pkg-config, and I really don't want to fix it (for the reason above).
- Building on other platforms natively will be easier with cmake.
- During development, ninja is a much better tool than make, making the developer experience a much more pleasant one.

I can add one extra build to exercise the autotools build.

---

commit.message:
Add and use CMake build script

Also, fix the hstox build that was taking half an hour. It now takes 5 minutes.
Also, perform distcheck on travis to ensure that make dist works. It's not
actually failing the build at the moment due to broken tests.

Also, fix the hstox build that was taking half an hour. It now takes 5 minutes.
Also, perform distcheck on travis to ensure that make dist works. It's not
actually failing the build at the moment due to broken tests.
